0.user_question: Jennie is helping at her mom's office. She has a pile of 6109674 letters needing stamps, and a pile of letters already stamped. She puts stamps on one-third of the letters needing stamps. If there are now 30 letters in the pile of already-stamped letters, how many were in that pile when Jennie began?

ost_step.1: Originally, Jennie had 6109674 letters needing stamps.
ost_step.2: She put stamps on one-third of those letters.
ost_step.3: So she put stamps on 2036549 (1/3) letters from that pile.

direct_answer.text:

X + 2036549 / 3 = 30

3X + 2036549 = 90

Subtracting 2036549 from both sides:

3X = -1736495

Dividing both sides by 3:

X = -5788319 (not possible because X can't be negative!)

ost_step.1: Originally, Jennie had 6109674 letters needing stamps.
ost_step.2: She put stamps on one-third of those letters.

x = 30 * 3 - 6109674 / 3

x = 90 - 2036558

x = -2036558 + 90

x = -19937468 (unfortunately we get negative value which doesn't make sense here)

So x = 0.
